name: salman.hashmi.site
description: My portfolio website showcasing my experience in work, class and personal projects. Devloped using ReactJS and Node.js with custom JavaScript and Animation on Scroll library animations.

name: naymah.hashmi.site
description: Portfolio website for architecture professional showcasing work performed by the individual. Developed using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP.

name: demo.weddingPHP.hashmi.site
description:
Responsive website designed to handle RSVPs for wedding. Developed using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP and SQL.  To view website, login with the following credentials:
First Name: testFirst
Last Name: testLast
City: testCity

name: demo.wedding.hashmi.site
description:
Responsive website designed to handle RSVPs for wedding. Developed using ReactJS, Node.js and SQL. To view website, login with the following credentials:
Name: testName
City: testCity

name: durbah.org
description: Responsive website designed to provide students relevant information information about upcoming seminars for the organization. Created functional admin panel which updates seminar information. Developed using ReactJS and Node.js.
extendedDescription: Responsive website designed to provide students relevant information information about upcoming seminars for the organization. Created functional admin panel which updates seminar information. Seminar information is exposed as REST API and fetched on the front-end. Developed using ReactJS and Node.js.

name: RUDestination
description: Mobile application used to provide students walking- and bus-directions to get from one building on campus to another. Currently developing Android app written in Java and Google Maps and TransLoc APIs, with plans to rebuild app in Flutter and Dart.
extendedDescription: Mobile application used to provide students walking- and bus-directions to get from one building on campus to another. Rutgers University has 5 sub-campuses within it's New Brunswick campus, making it overwhelming for new and transfer students to find their way between classes. This application strives to reduce the stress and make it easier for students to find their way around the University. Currently developing Android app written in Java with use of Google Maps and TransLoc APIs. Plans to rebuild app in Flutter and Dart in order to take advantage of cross-platform functionality and learning opportunity.

name: Spellcheck and Autocomplete
description: Performs real-time spellcheck and autocomplete operations against existing dictionary on text input. Sample will soon be avilable on the projects page and will allow searching for projects tag and by name. Developed in Java.

name: Reverse Words Sorter
description: Tokenizes an input string by any non-alphabetic delimiter and prints out all of the words in reverse order. Implemented in C for Systems Programming course.

name: Malloc and Free
description: Reproduced malloc and free to serve as proof-of-concept replacements of the original library functions. Simulated memory using a static array of 4096 bytes and implemented using metadata that stored content starting address and length to be accessed or freed later.

name: File Compressor
description: Developed a system that would implement the lossless Huffman Coding algorithm to compress, decompress or build a codebook based on any number of files recursively by descending through the directory structure.

name: Where's the File - Git Clone
description: Implemented version control system with client and server repositories and history (log), roll back (revert), commit, push, checkout and update (fetch) functionalities. Implementation makes use of multithreading and mutex locks in order to prevent race conditions and inconsistent data.

name: Song Library
description: Java application that manages a library of songs. Application can add to, remove from, edit and display song details in the library.

name: Photos Library
description: Java application that stores and manages libraries of photos for multiple users with admin and non-admin subsystems. Admin subsystems provides account creation, deletion and viewing of all users. Non-admin (typical user) subsystem allows user to add, remove, edit and search for photos by tag, as well as create and edit albums.

name: Chess
description: Terminal-based 2-player chess game. Users are able to play in chess with move-legality checks implemented, including basic valid piece moves, enpassant, check and checkmate detections.

name: Photos Library - Android
description: Simplified version of Photos Library Java application, but this time developed as an Android application. Application has the functionality of adding, removing and editing photos and albums for a single user. User can also search for photo by tag.

name: Expression Evaluation
description: Java application that performs arithmetic and evaluation operations on input string(s).

name: Little Search Engine
description: Reads in strings from provided text file and sorts strings in terms of frequency. Implemented binary search in order to determine placement of a each string.

name: Polynomial Calculator
description: Interprets polynomials from provided files and performs arithmetic and evaluation operations on them.

name: DOM Tree Modifier
description: Modifies DOM tree interpreted from file to add, remove or modify HTML tags.

name: ClassHub
description: Application designed to increase interactivity between students and instructors in otherwise impersonal in-class- and in-lecture- settings. Features include geolocation, chat to ask and upvote questions to instructor, in-app polls and quizzes in order to reduce interruptions throughout the lecture.

name: Linux Administration
description: Configure and maintain Virtual Private Server to host several static and dynamic websites. VPS is currently configured to run Java servlets and Node.js and PHP applications. VPS utilizes Nginx web server to serve as a reverse proxy to display the appropriate website.
